datasheets.name: Vynn Bane-Slayer

wargear.name: Weavefield Crest
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Vynn Bane-slayer is renowned amongst his kindred as an executioner of the direst threats and a ruthless guardian of his people’s future. Shielded by his suit of exoarmour, there is little that can slow his charge. When he hits home, the thunderous blows from his mass hammer strike hard enough to smash clean through armoured fortress gates.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ EINHYR HEARTHGUARD
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: Autoch-pattern combi-bolter; mass hammer; weavefield crest.

datasheets.name: Hearthkyn Warriors

other.name: Panspectral Scanning
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

special.description: Before the battle, at the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, this unit can be split into two units, each containing five models.
special.name: Patrol Squads

datasheets.fluff: Well‑armoured, well‑trained and equipped with powerful weaponry, Hearthkyn Warriors form the backbone of most oathbands. Led by their Theyns, they lay down hails of firepower, shrugging off the enemy’s return volleys before storming in to shatter their wavering foes for good.
datasheets.loadout:
■ The Theyn model is equipped with: Autoch-pattern bolt pistol; Theyn’s pistol; Theyn’s melee weapon.
■ 1 Hearthkyn Warrior model is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; HYLas auto rifle; close combat weapon.
■ 1 Hearthkyn Warrior model is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; magna‑rail rifle; close combat weapon.
■ 1 Hearthkyn Warrior model is equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; plasma knife.
■ 6 Hearthkyn Warrior models are equipped with: Autoch‑pattern bolt pistol; ion blaster; close combat weapon.

datasheets.name: Einhyr Hearthguard

other.name: Decisive Destruction
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible target, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in formidable exoarmour and equipped with a fearsome array of weaponry, Einhyr Hearthguard are a force to be reckoned with. Whether forming bodyguards around their oathband’s heroes or striking deep into the heart of enemy territory, they are unstoppable on the attack and immovable in defence.
datasheets.loadout:
■ The Hesyr model is additionally equipped with: volkanite disintegrator; exoarmour grenade launcher; graviton hammer.
■ Every Hearthguard is equipped with: volkanite disintegrator; exoarmour grenade launcher; plasma blade gauntlet.

datasheets.name: Brôkhyr Thunderkyn

other.name: Breaching Fire
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that enemy unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.

datasheets.fluff: When a Brôkhyr hooks into a powerful exoframe, they become Thunderkyn. Adapted from rigs used to maintain Kin spacecraft, these armoured exoskeletons exchange repair tools for massive heavy weapons, which the Brôkhyr use to lay down withering covering fire for the oathbands and to pick off enemy armour.
datasheets.loadout: ■ Every model is equipped with: SP conversion beamer; close combat weapon.

abilities.name: Conversion
abilities.description: Each time an attack is made with this weapon, if the target is more than 24" from the bearer, an unmodified successful Hit roll of 4+ scores a Critical Hit.

stratagems.name: Point-Blank Fusillade
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PISTOL] ability.
stratagems.fluff: So resolute and steadfast are the Kin that their warriors can keep aiming and firing even amid close‑quarters battle.

stratagems.name: Ancestral Endurance
stratagems.target: One HEARTHKYN WARRIORS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack targets your unit, models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack and if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than your unit’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Under dread barrages from the foe, the renowned endurance of Hearthkyn Warriors comes to the fore. They draw upon reserves of stamina and weather the worst in the hopes of living up to the expectations of the ancestors they know are watching.

stratagems.name: Contemptuous Rebuff
stratagems.target: One LEAGUES OF VOTANN unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from the result.
stratagems.fluff: Spitting scorn at their oncoming foes, the Kin fearlessly launch an aggressive counterattack. This unexpected surge, fuelled by the angry disdain of the Kin, has unnerved many a foe who expected to overwhelm them easily.

enhancements.name: Indomitable Exemplar
enhancements.description: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

enhancements.name: Torvâhl Mass Drivers
enhancements.description:
■ Each time the bearer ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it, then roll one D6: on a 2‑4, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 5‑6, that enemy unit suffers 2 mortal wounds.
■ Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of the bearer Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.
